name: Corveus Medical
headline: Catheter-based solution to treat chronic heart failure.
description: Our device catheter-based device is able to safely perform a targeted nerve ablation in the upper abdomen. Cardiologists are concerned about collateral tissue damage in ablation procedures - our probe not only targets a very specific area, but also confirms that it’s done correctly.

founders.name: Tyler Melton, Founder
founders.description: Medical Device | Biomedical Engineering | Business Strategy

# CORVEUS MEDICAL
Relieving The Burden of Chronic Heart Failure
[Learn More](https://www.corveusmedical.com/<https:/www.corveusmedical.com>)
###### The Solution
Corveus Medical is based in Houston, Texas and is developing a minimally-invasive solution to congestive heart failure.
​
Our device deactivates a nerve that has been demonstrated to be a driver behind heart failure, allowing physicians to treat patients that has traditionally had little to no options and improve quality of life.
![Performing Surgery](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/11062b_ebed553b419a414fadd847af8f58f23f~mv2_d_8660_5773_s_4_2.jpg/v1/fill/w_490,h_394,al_c,q_80,usm_0.66_1.00_0.01,enc_avif,quality_auto/11062b_ebed553b419a414fadd847af8f58f23f~mv2_d_8660_5773_s_4_2.jpg)
###### Developing a new way to prevent heart failure
Recent publications have shown significant benefit when removing a specific nerve signal. Our goal is to develop a device that safely access this nerve, providing consistent results.
​
Our solution removes a branch of the nerve and confirm procedure success, which provides confidence to physicians and durable benefit to patients.
###### Our Mission
Corveus’ goal is to provide an effective, and safe, treatment option for moderate heart failure patients who currently do not have many options. 
[Meet The team](https://www.corveusmedical.com/<https:/www.corveusmedical.com/team>)

generated_description:
Corveus Medical is a Houston-based startup founded in 2021, and it’s on a mission to tackle a significant issue in cardiovascular care: chronic heart failure. They’ve come up with a catheter-based solution that stands out in the crowded field of medical devices. 

So, what exactly does Corveus do? Their innovative device is designed to perform a targeted nerve ablation in the upper abdomen, which deactivates a nerve known to contribute to heart failure. This process is notable for its precision. Unlike traditional ablation techniques that might cause collateral damage to surrounding tissues, Corveus's approach targets the affected area while also confirming that the procedure has been completed successfully. This is a game-changer for cardiologists concerned about the risks associated with nerve ablation.

Corveus Medical is part of Y Combinator's Winter 2022 batch, which means they are among a carefully selected group of startups gaining valuable mentorship and resources to accelerate their growth. Despite being a small team of just three employees, they’re backed by significant industry partnerships, including collaboration with Nan.

The company is focused on a humanitarian goal: providing effective, safe treatment options for moderate heart failure patients, a demographic often left with limited choices. They recognize the unmet need in this space and are committed to improving the quality of life for these patients.

If you’d like to learn more about their work or track their progress, you can visit their website at [Corveus Medical](https://www.corveusmedical.com). They are positioning themselves not just as a medical device company, but as pioneers in a crucial area of healthcare.
